com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.levenshtein

Class LazyTransducerCollection<DictionaryNode,CandidateType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.collection.AbstractIterator<CandidateType>
      • com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.levenshtein.LazyTransducerCollection<DictionaryNode,CandidateType>
  • Type Parameters:
    DictionaryNode - Kind of nodes of the dictionary automaton.
    CandidateType - Kind of the spelling candidates returned from the dictionary.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICandidateCollection<CandidateType>, Iterable<CandidateType>, Iterator<CandidateType>

    public class LazyTransducerCollection<DictionaryNode,CandidateType>
extends AbstractIterator<CandidateType>
implements ICandidateCollection<CandidateType>

    The algorithm for imitating Levenshtein automata was taken from the following journal article: 

     
  @ARTICLE {Schulz02faststring,
 author = {Klaus Schulz and Stoyan Mihov},
 title = {Fast String Correction with Levenshtein-Automata},
 journal = {INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF DOCUMENT ANALYSIS AND RECOGNITION},
 year = {2002},
 volume = {5},
 pages = {67--85}
 }

    As well, this Master Thesis helped me understand its concepts:

    • www.fmi.uni-sofia.bg/fmi/logic/theses/mitankin-en.pdf

    The supervisor of the student who submitted the thesis was one of the authors of the journal article, above.

    Since:
    2.1.2

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int a
      Helper variable used when determining the length of a characteristic vector.
      private TransducerAttributes<DictionaryNode,CandidateType> attributes
      Attributes required for this transducer to search the dictionary.
      private String candidate
      Prefix of the dictionary, from its root to dictionaryNode.
      private DictionaryNode dictionaryNode
      Dictionary node represented by the current intersection between the dictionary automaton and the Levenshtein automaton.
      private int i
      Offset of where to begin traversing the next characteristic vector.
      private int k
      Length of the next characteristic vector to return.
      private CharIterator labels
      Labels of the outgoing transitions for a dictionary state.
      private IState levenshteinState
      Levenshtein state represented by the current intersection between the dictionary automaton and the Levenshtein automaton.
      private int maxDistance
      Maximum number of spelling errors candidates may have from the query term.
      private Deque<Intersection<DictionaryNode>> pendingQueue
      Breadth-first traversal of the dictionary automaton.
      private IStateTransitionFunction stateTransition
      Transitions one state to another.
      private String term
      Query term whose spelling should be corrected.

      • characteristicVector

        private boolean[] characteristicVector(char x,
                                       String term,
                                       int k,
                                       int i)
        Returns the characteristic vector of the term, from its characters between index i and index k. The characteristic vector contains true at each index where the corresponding character of the term is the value of x, and false elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        x - char to find all occurrences of in the relevant substring of term
        term - Term in which to find all occurrences of the character, x
        k - Length of the substring of term to examine
        i - Base-index of the substring of term to examine
        Returns:
        Characteristic vector marking where x appears in the relevant substring of term.
